result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquise L Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On 3/15/16 court approves huber granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08 beginning 04/21/16.

miscConds.notes: $500 Bail applied. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
Defendant to submit to random testing. 
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment. 
Defendant must submit DNA sample. 
Pay supervision fees. 
Pistol is forfeited.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marquise L Simpson in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Marquise L Simpson in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel states matter has been resolved and requests to proceed to plea/sentencing today. Case to be recalled later this morning.

ADDRESS INFO for Marquise L Simpson
Current: 4112 N 80th St, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 12-15-2015)
Prior: 2933 W Fairmount Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Jury status hearing at 12-23-2015 08:30 am

Attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lynch-German states she has not had any contact with her client and is unsure as to why he is not in court. State requests bench warrant issued. Court orders bench warrant issued and cash bond to be forfeited. 10:27 a.m. case re-called; Defendant Marquise L Simpson now in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German. State requests warrant to stay noting that defendant was not to be a minute late. State requests $15,000 cash bond if court withdraws warrant. Counsel states defendant late due to childcare issue. Court withdraws warrant.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquise L Simpson by video conference from the Ozaukee Co Jail with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz as friend of the court.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises defendant turned self in on warrant, requesting reinstatement of cash bail.   State requests another $500 cash bail.  Counsel advises Attorney Lynch-German will continue to represent defendant.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
Defendant nor Attorney Lynch-German has contacted the court therefore jury trial on 12-15-15 removed from the calendar.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests adjournment of jury trial. State requests warrant be issued for failure to appear. Court will pass case until later today. 9:49 am/Court resumes with same appearances. Defendant not in court.  Court finds probable cause.  Upon defendant's failure to appear, court orders warrant to issue. Forfeit any bail. State requests trial remain on calendar until the end of the day. Court, trial will remain on the calendar for the next day or so. Counsel to contact clerk by 11/19/15. If defendant is not in custody by then, jury trial to be removed.
